page.title: 01Landscape:soils & settlement
page.content: The area is rural with evenly dispersed farms and two tiny hamlets centered on{Evesbatch}and{Uplands.}A church service is held at Evesbatch once a fortnight but all other social functions are sought outside the area. The underlying geology is of Devonian sandstone incised by the {River Leadon}and its tributaries to give undulating topography with fairly steep slopes, which in places give moderate limitations that restrict choice of crops and demand careful management, through gradient, shallow soils and liability to soil erosion. In valley bottoms problems of wetness occur, in places combatted by improved field drainage. Farms have amalgamated and land use has adapted to changing markets. Professional classes are replacing farm workers in renovated residences.
